Detailed Description

GenerateMapServer GfxData.

A GfxData with some extra features needed when the map is created.

Member Function Documentation

bool GMSGfxData::addOutline (  GMSGfxData *  externGfx  ) 
 

Concatinates two polygones into one.

They have to share at least one point. Constructed to make it possible to build the gfxData for the intire map (that consist of a number of municipals). NB! Not a trust-worthy method!!!

Parameters:
externGfx Pointer to "the other" gfxData.
externPolygon Polygon of the externGfx to concatenate. Default set to MAX_UINT16 which means that all polygones of externGfx are to be concatenated.

bool GMSGfxData::coordPairInPoly (  GMSGfxData *  gfxData,
coordinate_type  coord1Lat,
coordinate_type  coord1Lon,
coordinate_type  coord2Lat,
coordinate_type  coord2Lon
)  [private]
 

Help function to surroundedByOtherPolys.

Checks if a coordinate pair exists as an adjacent coordinate pair in a polygon.

bool GMSGfxData::createFromMif (  ifstream &  infile  ) 
 

Create this gfxData from a mif-file.

Use this method when there is only ONE gfxdata in the mif-file, e.g. country polygons for country overview maps. Method reads the mif header and then the file, using the "readMifHeader" and "createGfxFromMif" methods. Init this gfxData without adding first polygon.

Parameters:
infile The file that contains the mif-data.
Returns:
True if this GfxData is created alright, false otherwise.

GMSGfxData* GMSGfxData::createGfxData (  GMSGfxData **  gfxs,
int  nbrGfxs
)  [static]
 

Create a new GfxData and fill it with the outline of the GfxData's given as parameter.

The array with GfxDatas will not be destroyed, and these GfxDatas will not be deleted. The GfxData returned by this method must be deleted by the caller!

Parameters:
gfxs An array with pointers to the GfxData's that should be included in the new GfxData.
nbrGfxs The number of GfxData's in the gfxs-array.
Returns:
A new GfxData, created in this method, that is set to the outline of the ones given as parameter.

bool GMSGfxData::createGfxFromMif (  ifstream &  infile,
CoordinateTransformer::format_t  coordsys,
bool  normalOrderOfCoordinates,
uint32  utmzone,
int32  falseNorthing,
int32  falseEasting
) 
 

Create this gfxData from a mif-file.

The method reads only one pline/region from the file.

Parameters:
infile The mif file.
coordsys The coordinate system used in the mif file.
normalOrderOfCoordinates "Normal" order is lat,lon or x,y.
utmzone The zone number for utm-coordinates.
falseNorthing Any addition to the latitude coordinate.
falseEasting Any addition to the longitude coordinate.
Returns:
True if ok.

Help method to createGfxFromMif.

Read from mif file until next valid mif feature is found. Valid features are: Region, Pline, Line, Point.

GMSGfxData* GMSGfxData::mergePolygons (  GfxData *  complexGfx  )  [static]
 

Merge the polygons of one complex gfxData.

Returns:
The merged gfxData, or NULL if no merging was done e.g. if the complex only has 1 polygon.

GMSGfxData* GMSGfxData::mergeTwoPolygons (  GMSGfxData *  otherGfx,
GMSGfxData *  polygonGfxs[],
uint16  nbrPolygons,
uint16  p,
uint16  mergep,
bool  mergePolygonsWithMultipleTouches,
bool &  foundMultipleTouches
)  [private]
 

Merge another gfx data into this one.

The polygons are merged if they are closed, have at least 3 coords, bbox overlaps, have the same orientation. The result is "falukorv" polygons.

Parameters:
otherGfx The gfx data to merge into this one.
Returns:
The result of the merge, or NULL if the two gfx datas were not merged.

bool GMSGfxData::printMif (  ofstream &  outfile  )  const
 

Write this GfxData to a mif-file.

Parameters:
outfile The file to save this GfxData into.
Returns:
True if this GfxData is saved into the file, false otherwise.

bool GMSGfxData::readMifHeader (  ifstream &  infile,
CoordinateTransformer::format_t &  coordsys,
bool &  normalOrderOfCoordinates,
uint32 &  utmzone,
int32 &  falseNorthing,
int32 &  falseEasting
)  [static]
 

Read the header of a mif-file to find out the coordinate system for the coordinates in the file.

The file is read until "Data" is found or until eof(). By default the coordinate system is set to "mc2" and the normalOrderOfCoordinates to "true". Then if an optional coordinate system (the "Coordsys" tag) is found in the mif header, the parameters are updated to comply with that value.

Parameters:
infile The mif file.
coordsys Outparam, the coordinate system used.
normalOrderOfCoordinates Outparam, "normal" order is lat,lon or x,y.
utmzone Outparam, the zone number for utm-coordinates.
falseNorthing Outparam, any addition to the latitude.
falseEasting Outparam, any addition to the longitude.
Returns:
True if "Data" tag was found in the mif file, false if eof() was reached. Returning true means that, if the header contains an optional coordinate system the outparameters have been set according to that coordinate system, else default values are returned.

GMSGfxData* GMSGfxData::removeInsideCoordinates (  GfxDataFull *  complexGfx  )  [static]
 

Creates a new GMSGfxData and fills it with the outline of ALL polygons of the complexGfx given as parameter.

Island polygons (polygons that do not fit with the others) are added the the returnGfx as new polygons. The method is quite slow, so it should not be used on polygons with too many coordinates. Holes are removed.

Parameters:
complexGfx The gfxData that is to be simplified.
Returns:
A new GfxData, created in this method, that is filled with the outline of the one given as parameter.

bool GMSGfxData::surroundedByOtherPolys (  GMSGfxData *  otherGfx,
GMSGfxData *  polygonGfxs[],
uint16  nbrPolygons,
uint32  p,
uint32  mergep,
uint32  mySharedEnd,
uint32  myNbrCoords,
uint32  otherSharedEnd,
uint32  otherNbrCoords
)  [private]
 

Help function to mergeTwoPolys.

Checks if an intersection point between two polys is surrounded by other polys (other than the two considered). When two polys intersect in one coord only, we only want to merge them if this intersection point is surrounded by other polys, and thus will disappear in forthcoming merges with next polygons.

bool GMSGfxData::updateLength (  uint16  polyIdx = MAX_UINT16  )  [virtual]

Reimplemented from GfxDataFull.
